title: How to Use a Sniper Rifle Accurately in Destiny

steps.headline: Equip a sniper rifle from the character menu.
Wait for it to materialize in your hands, and check to see if it has ammo.
steps.description: If it doesn't, pick some up (in story mode, pick up ammo from fallen enemies. In the Crucible, there are ammo crates placed throughout the map).

steps.headline: Find a good spot to snipe.
steps.description: You need to be semi-hidden (your tag is easy to spot, and you also need to see).

steps.headline: Crouch and draw up the sights.
steps.description: Practice with it at first. Line up the reticle with a target, and shoot.

steps.headline: Try it on an enemy.
steps.description: Move the reticle in sync with the enemy, and fire.

steps.headline: Get used to the fire rate and power of your sniper rifle.
Learn to draw up the sights and take a quick shot.
steps.description: This is known as a "quickscope" in other first person shooters, but it is rather impractical in Destiny. Still, it is a useful skill to master.

steps.headline: Upgrade your sniper rifle, or buy a new one.
steps.description: As you progress, you will earn more and more options for equipment. Find a sniper rifle that works well with you.

steps.headline: Fire on the move.
steps.description: As you get used to your weapon, experiment your shooting styles. Try shooting from the waist, or "no-scoping".

steps.headline: Adapt to the maps.
steps.description: Pick spots that work for you, and settle yourself properly.

text: Equip a sniper rifle from the character menu.  Wait for it to materialize in your hands, and check to see if it has ammo. This is known as a "quickscope" in other first person shooters, but it is rather impractical in Destiny. Still, it is a useful skill to master. Upgrade your sniper rifle, or buy a new one. As you progress, you will earn more and more options for equipment. Find a sniper rifle that works well with you. Fire on the move. As you get used to your weapon, experiment your shooting styles. Try shooting from the waist, or "no-scoping". Adapt to the maps. Pick spots that work for you, and settle yourself properly.
